Cell.Data:
Há cerca de 40 anos, um chocolatier iniciante entrou em cena e ajudou a restaurar a fortuna do outrora grande império do chocolate, a Baumeister Confections.

A empresa voltou a passar por momentos difíceis. Estamos na agitada década de 1920 e eles simplesmente não acompanharam o espírito de inovação necessário para se manterem competitivos no mercado de confeitos de hoje.

Alexandra Tangye, neta de Evangeline Baumeister, tem um grande plano para tentar mudar as coisas, mas ela precisa da sua ajuda…
Copyright (c) 2007 PlayFirst, Inc. Todos os direitos reservados.

Os Baumeisters estão de volta, mas com problemas mais uma vez! Algo não está certo na sede e Alex precisa da sua ajuda! Você tem o que é preciso para conquistar o mundo através do chocolate mais uma vez? Baixe a versão completa e descubra!

Na versão completa, você define os níveis de produção para cada receita em um minijogo no estilo arcade. Combine os ingredientes da esteira transportadora da fábrica em bandejas em uma infinidade de layouts para fazer o máximo de chocolates que puder em um minuto. Para a versão web, definimos sua produção em 15 caixas por semana. Baixe a versão completa e experimente o minijogo!
2 modos de jogo: História e Jogo Grátis
click to add to the tray
click to remove from the tray

select an ingredient at the left
to fill this slot
At %1% each, how many sacks would you like to buy?
I'll pay %1% a case, how many would you like to sell?
Este porto ainda não está disponível.
Esta porta deve ser aberta em %story_mode%
Production is stalled at one of your factories!
Set %1% factory to produce %2% cases of %3% per week
Click on a chocolate to view its recipe.
Click on a chocolate to review the recipe and prepare your factory for production.
You do not currently know this recipe - sure looks delicious, though…
This is a recipe you will need to develop in your Chocolates Tasting Laboratory.
This factory is set to make %1% per week.
Your %1% factory will make %2% per week.
Bought %1% sacks of %2% for %3% each at %4%.
Sold %1% cases of %2% for %3% each at %4%.
The port of %1% is now available.
Congratulations, you have been promoted to %1%.
You are now the proud owner of %1%!
Your inventory of %1% is deteriorating in storage from lack of use.
Are you sure you want to save your progress and quit %gametitle%?
That name is already taken. Please enter a unique name for your saved game.
Are you sure you want to delete the player named %1%?
That name is already in use. Please choose a different name.

%free_mode% is locked until you have started your player in %story_mode%.

Click on %story_mode% to begin %gametitle%.
Você não tem dinheiro suficiente para fazer essa compra ...
Você não parece ter nada para vender, mas volte quando tiver. Estamos sempre em busca de novos produtos e ficaremos felizes em comprar qualquer coisa que você tenha a oferecer a um preço razoável.
Tem certeza que quer me vender todos os chocolates que possui?

[player], parece que suas fábricas estão paralisadas, você não tem nada para vender e não tem dinheiro suficiente para buscar fortuna em outro lugar. Odeio ver um empresário fracassar, então quero lhe dar %1% sem amarras. Se você recusar, sua carreira estará encerrada. Quer pegar esse dinheiro e continuar jogando?
Bem, acho que isso é um adeus, então! Obrigado por tentar sua mão no mundo da Chocolatier!
[player], parece que você tem muito produto, mas pouco dinheiro. Eu ficaria feliz em retirar todo o estoque de chocolates de suas mãos por %1%. Interessado?
Você parece estar em uma situação difícil, [player]. Não se preocupe, estou aqui para ajudá-lo. Você estaria interessado em me vender todos os ingredientes que você tem em mãos por %1%?
Have at least %1% cases of %2% in inventory
Have at least %1% cases of %2% in inventory (%3% more cases)
Display the message '%1%' in the ledger.
Quest variable '%1%' must be less than %2%.
Quest variable '%1%' must be more than %2%.
Feeling lucky, [player]? Would you care to try your hand at a simple game of chance?

Raise or lower your bet and press %start%.
The more you wager, the more I'll place in these crates.
Open crates, and stop at any time to keep the money you've uncovered. But uncover a whammy, and I'll keep all the dough....
OK, I've put more than %1% in these crates. Open as many as you wish, but remember: uncover a whammy and the game ends.
There are still more crates to open! Go ahead and open another one, or click %done% to bank your winnings…
Stop now or open more crates… the choice is yours!
You can avoid a loss by clicking %done%, or keep trying for more.
Well, that's it. Once you uncover a whammy the game's over. I'll keep your bet and wish you better luck next time…
Nicely done. It pays not to be too greedy!
Greetings, [player]! Might you be interested in a sporting toss of the dice?

We'll each roll 4 die, and the highest 4-dice total wins.
It will cost you %1% to play, but you will have a chance to add to your bet after you have rolled your first 2 dice.
.
Click "%roll_dice%" to start….
Your first two dice total %1%. Think you'll beat my four-dice total? Raise your bet if you'd like, then click %roll_dice% again and we'll find out…
or continue opening crates to try for more!
You got me this time! You win %2%.
Looks like I win %2%. Better luck next time!
It's a tie! I'll keep the %1%, and you keep the rest.
Won %2% playing crates on a %1% bet.
Broke even playing crates on a %1% bet.
In order to make %1%, we'll have to outfit the factory with some new equipment. It'll cost %2%. Want to buy it now?
To make %1%, we'll have to spend %2% on new equipment. Better come back when you have the money.
This factory is equipped to make:
This factory is for sale alright, but it will cost you %1% -- come back and see me when you've got the cash.
This factory's in fine shape, and it can be yours for just %1%. Would you like to purchase it now?

I've paused the machines for you, boss.

Let me know when you're ready, and you can continue where you left off.
In order to crank up the machines to start working on that recipe, we'll need to have all the required ingredients on hand. The following ingredients are still needed:

Aim and click to fire ingredients.
Match the full tray you see on the right.

I'll speed the machines up as you succeed.
Waste ingredients, and I'll slow things down.

Good luck!

Match the full tray you see on the right.

Fill each tray with ingredients of the same color for a production bonus.

Waste 8 ingredients, and I'll be forced to halt the machines.

Good luck!

Uh-oh! Wasted ingredient!

Make sure you are firing a needed ingredient at the tray. Use that full tray on the right as your guide.

I'll keep track of each ingredient you waste up on the right. Waste 8, and I'll be forced to halt production...

Good stuff! Matching colors in a single tray helps us streamline the production process.

Keep matching those colors and watch our production efficiency skyrocket!
The flashing red indicator on the Map signifies that production is stalled at one of your factories! Check out the Factory Status window to find out where to buy the ingredients you have run out of….

Not too shabby, there, boss.

%1% cases... The more cases of chocolates you make here, the more we'll be able to make each week, and the faster you'll see your profits climb.

Nice job, boss!

We'll be making %1% cases per week. Remember, the more cases of chocolates we produce each week, the more money we can make!

Wow, you have really got a way with those machines!

You just keep the ingredients on hand, and we'll keep cranking out %1% cases per week, the rate you just established.

Yowza!

I can't believe you just cranked out %1% cases! You are truly a gifted chocolate-maker...

Whoa!

Ingredients were flying everywhere, so I had to shut things down to clean up and recalibrate. But we still managed to recover %1% cases.

Remember to match the full tray on the right.

That wasn't too bad: %1% cases.

Remember that we'll make this many cases each week, as long as you have the ingredients on hand.

Good work, boss!

We're all set up to make %1% cases per week. Remember, the more cases of chocolates you produce, the more money you can earn!

Even I must admit that was some fancy chocolate-making!

You just keep the ingredients on hand, and we'll keep cranking out %1% cases per week, the rate you just established.

I haven't seen chocolate-making like that in some time!

I can't believe you just cranked out %1% cases!

Yikes!

Ingredients were flying everywhere, so I had to shut things down to clean up and recalibrate. But you did manage to make %1% cases.

Remember to match the full tray on the right.
Come on now, [player]. %1% cases per week? We can certainly handle greater capacity, and remember: The higher your efficiency here, the more chocolates we'll make each week...

That was not too bad!

We're now prepared to fabricate %1% cases per week, as long as you've got the ingredients. Remember, the more we can make, the more you can sell!

Wow, you have really got a way with those machines!

You just keep the ingredients on hand, and we'll keep cranking out %1% cases per week, the rate you just established.

My goodness, ! You just manufactured %1% cases!

You certainly have a way with those machines.

You wasted 8 ingredients, so I had to cut short production. But we still managed to recover %1% cases.

Remember to match the full tray on the right.

Not too shabby, there, boss.

%1% cases... The more cases of chocolates you make here, the more we'll be able to make each week, and the faster you'll see your profits climb.

Nice job, boss!

We'll be making %1% cases per week. Remember, the more cases of chocolates we produce each week, the more money we can make!

Wow, you have really got a way with those machines!

You just keep the ingredients on hand, and we'll keep cranking out %1% cases per week, the rate you just established.

Yowza!

I can't believe you just cranked out %1% cases! You are truly a gifted chocolate-maker...

Whoa!

Ingredients were flying everywhere, so I had to shut things down to clean up and recalibrate. But we still managed to recover %1% cases.

Remember to match the full tray on the right.

I've seen better, and I've seen worse.

%1% cases per week is a respectable amount. Do I think you can do better? I do, indeed….

Nice work!

We're now set to produce %1% cases every week. Remember, the more cases of chocolates we make, the more profit you can expect!

Impressive!

You make sure you've got the needed ingredients on hand, and we'll keep manufacturing %1% cases per week…

Unbelievable!

You just turned out %1% cases! It has been some time since I saw anyone handle the machinery that well.
Ingredients were flying this way and that, so I had to stop production to deal with the mess. But you did make %1% cases, so we will make this many each week going forward….

That was alright, [player].

You made %1% cases, so we'll in turn make %1% cases each week. As you know, the more chocolates your make, the more money you can earn…

Not a bad showing, boss.

We'll keep right on making %1% cases per week, so long as you keep the ingredients we need in stock.

Well, well, I do say, not too shabby!!

You just keep on top of the ingredients, and we'll keep assembling %1% cases per week, the rate you just established.

Astonishing!

I just witnessed some incredible chocolate-making - you managed to produce %1% cases!

Oh my, we can't have ingredients flying all about the production floor. I had to stop things for a bit to clean up and recalibrate. But we still managed to salvage %1% cases.

Remember to match the full tray on the right.
Yes indeed, boss, you've now established our manufacturing efficiency at %1% cases per week. We'll keep right on going, as long as we have the ingredients we need.

Kudos, boss!

Don’t worry about a thing - other than keeping the ingredients in stock. As long as you've got them, we'll keep concocting %1% cases per week.

Excellent work, boss!

We'll keep manufacturing chocolates at the rate you just established: %1% cases per week!

%1% cases!

I've seen a fair amount of chocolate-making in my time, and that was sincerely some fine, fine work.

Oh no!

With ingredients heading this way and that, I was forced to suspend production! You were able to churn out %1% cases. We can run with this rate, if you approve.

Saudações, [player]. Você precisa ter atingido o rank %rank_2% para poder comprar o laboratório de degustação de chocolate, onde podemos combinar ingredientes normais e secretos para desenvolver novas receitas. Volte depois de atingir %rank_2%, e discutiremos os detalhes.

Você ainda não possui este laboratório. Depois de fazer isso, trabalharemos juntos para combinar ingredientes secretos (encontrados em portas secretas) com ingredientes normais (encontrados em todos os outros lugares) para desenvolver algumas receitas surpreendentes e incrivelmente lucrativas juntos. O laboratório custará %1%, então volte quando tiver o dinheiro e estiver pronto para dar o próximo passo.

Você ainda não possui este laboratório de degustação de chocolates, onde trabalharemos juntos para combinar ingredientes secretos (encontrados em portos secretos) com ingredientes normais (encontrados em todos os outros lugares) para desenvolver algumas receitas incríveis e incrivelmente lucrativas juntos.

O laboratório pode ser seu por %1% - - gostaria de adquiri-lo agora?
Estamos aqui para ajudar, mas não podemos fazer nada sem ingredientes secretos, infelizmente. Volte com alguns ingredientes secretos saborosos para nós experimentarmos.
Infelizmente, não seremos capazes de desenvolver receitas comercializáveis com esses ingredientes agora.

Estamos ocupados lavando tubos de ensaio, limpando prateleiras e reabastecendo suprimentos após seus últimos esforços saborosos. Volte em algumas semanas e estaremos prontos para ajudá-lo novamente. E lembre-se, estamos sempre em busca de novas idéias e ingredientes secretos!
Essa com certeza é uma incrível variedade de ingredientes que você coletou para nós ao longo dos anos!
Vou pegar um saco de cada ingrediente que não vimos antes para mantê-lo à mão aqui para seus experimentos. Entre e veremos se há uma receita comercial para descobrir ...
Não podemos fazer algo do nada! Volte quando tiver alguns ingredientes novos em seu inventário.
Esses ingredientes parecem promissores. Encha a bandeja com aqueles que você gostaria que experimentássemos.
Agora clique %tasteit%. Faremos um lote e avaliaremos a comercialização da receita.
Silly…! That's the recipe for %1%, already in your repertoire.
That’s a good recipe, but I'm afraid it is patented. You'll have to find some other way to get a hold of it….
We won't be able to create any new %1% with the ingredients you have. Let's stick with %2% for now.
We've done all we can here in the lab with %1%, but who knows? Someone out there may still have a %1% recipe to teach you…
Marvelous! We'll call these "%1%." I'll add it to your recipe book now…
You'll need some Cacao to make something with these ingredients…..
This would benefit from a different cacao flavor.
Perhaps mixing a few different cacaos would smooth this out?
Chocolate is sweet stuff….you might want to try a little Sugar?
You know, all Truffles require a little dusting of Truffle Powder…
One of those secret ingredients you've brought us should give this just the kick it needs.
This could really do with something a bit nuttier.
A hint of fruit would do this a world of good.
How about something spicy or a little flavoring?
Hmmmm. We're getting somewhere. How about a little more %1%?
Not terrible, but you might try something a little different…
That combination may not be good for %1%, but try again if you're working on %2%.
That combination may not be good for %1%, but it does show promise…
Better keep trying boss... That was hardly edible!
Ack! What are you trying to do here, poison us?!
Reserved for a recipe that uses at least one secret ingredient.

Congratulations! You have achieved the Rank of %rank_1%, and been awarded the 1925 %med_novice%.

You are well on your way!
For collecting at least six squares recipes in your Recipe Book, you have been awarded the %med_square%.
Society for Increased Indulgence Badge of Honor
The %med_infusion% is given to those chocolate-makers who have accumulated at least seven recipes for Infusions.
Presented to those chocolate-makers who have taken the bold step of purchasing their first chocolate shop.
Chocolate Lovers Society "One to Taste" Award
Chocolate manufacturers who have attained the rank of %rank_2% receive the %med_entrep%.
Players who have amassed at least nine Sauce recipes in their repertoire earn the coveted %med_sauce%.
Accorded to those who have decided to contribute to the work of invention by taking ownership of the Chocolate Tasting Laboratory.
Conferred upon those innovators who strive to expand the boundaries of chocolate by developing at least 2 recipes at their Tasting Laboratory.
Royal Swedish Academy of Sweets Medal of Distinction
Granted to those players who have accumulated at least ten Pralines recipes.
Chocolate Historical Guild Champion of Industry Prize
Awarded to those chocolatiers who have taken ownership of all six chocolate-making factories in the world.
World Chocolate Congress Annual Achievement Disc
For those dedicated chocolate-makers who have managed to collect eleven recipes for Truffles.
International Year of Chocolate Shimmering Star
Only the most outstanding chocolatiers who have filled their entire recipe book are awarded the %med_exotic%.
International Society of Chocolate Manufacturers Leadership Chalice
A prize for those successful women and men in the chocolate business who have reached the rank of %rank_3%.
Awarded to those who, in the service of their enterprise, have visited each and every port in the world.
Bestowed upon those who have climbed the corporate ladder, and achieved the ultimate rank of %rank_4%.

Smell the spices of the market! The quality here is top-notch. Try a sample!
I source my goods locally so they are as fresh as possible. What you see here just arrived this morning.
Your products will be the best they can be if you buy your ingredients from me!
Look closely, friend, and you'll see the finest quality available anywhere.
My family has sold goods in this market for generations, and we have reached near perfect quality in our goods.
It is not everywhere you will find goods as fresh as these, my friend.
All good products start with good ingredients.
Trust me, you can search far and wide and not find ingredients this fresh at prices this reasonable.
In for a bit of haggling are we? What can I do for you?
It is not easy to keep such wonderful ingredients in stock for my customers...
Might you be able to make me a deal?
My, isn't this a lovely day?
It seems to me that prices have gone up lately, don't you think so?
Your prices seem just a little bit high to me...
I'm ready to buy, as long as the price is right.
I recall seeing some of these items for less in other ports...
Might there be some flexibility in your prices?
I understand that there's no such thing as a fixed price in this town?
I'm already offering you the lowest prices in town!
Please, you must realize these ingredients are not easy to come by. Are my prices not fair?
Are you kidding? My own mother just purchased some ingredients from me at a higher price!
My brother told me this very morning: "[vendor], remember what happened last time you lowered your prices? You had to sell the shirt from your back in order to feed your family."
Check the quality of these goods and you'll see they're worth the price. I only buy from the finest producers.
Look. These are my prices. I think you will find they are fair.
I am not of a mind to negotiate with you right now. My prices are firm.
Listen. You know what it's like here in [port]. I have a family to feed, too…
You and I both know that these are extremely fair prices for the quality you find here in my market.
How dare you insult me so! Mine are the finest goods available. If anything, they should command the highest prices possible! Now pay or be gone.
Why can you not be happy with my already low and very fair prices? Well... you lost your chance to be reasonable, my friend. Check out these prices!
Perhaps you do not understand... I can charge whatever I feel is appropriate. Now, either buy from me at these prices or be gone from [market].
I grow tired of your company. Either make a purchase or be off!
I just heard from a trusted friend that my recent order will be late. I'm afraid I'll have to raise my prices.
Enough is enough. Now pay or be gone.
Now you have gone too far. How do you like these prices?
You have tried my patience. My prices are now going up.
You've got me thinking, all right. I think my prices are too low. I am afraid I am going to raise them.
Maybe next time you'll recognize a good deal when you see one. For now, my prices have just gone up.
I suppose I could shave a bit off these prices. What do you think?
You drive a hard bargain, but I would like to keep you as a regular customer. How do these prices look?
For you, my friend, I can make a very special offer.
Okay, okay. I can lower my prices a bit, but my children will go hungry tonight!
If I say this out loud the other vendors here will be angry... so I'm going to write some new prices on this piece of paper. What do you think?
I am interested in making a sale here. I guess I can do something….this time.
I don't normally do this, but I'm in a wonderful mood today. How do these prices look to you?
I can give you a break this time, but don't be expecting this kind of treatment every time you come by...
Wow! You drive a hard bargain. I won't make a dime at these prices; I hope you're happy.
Of course I can do something for you, such a special customer.
Your chocolates appear to be top notch! How can I help you?
We're always interested in buying quality goods from friendly manufacturers.
Welcome, chocolatier. Let's do some business, shall we?
It is my pleasure to welcome you to my shop.
There is something you'd like to discuss?
I have customers to attend to. Is there something you need from me?
Ah, [player]. How is my favorite chocolatier today?
We pride ourselves on carrying only the finest sweets available.
You're not going to try to butter me up here, are you?
Okay. You have my full attention.
If you take a close look, you'll see my products are of the finest quality.
Our manufacturing process is quite demanding and costs a lot of money…
I'm wondering if I might be able to talk you into giving me a better price for my wares.
I have some new products to share, and I think you'll find them quite popular with your customers.
What a lovely shop you have here!
We have been experiencing a spike in demand for our chocolates lately…
I'll need a touch more incentive to sell these incredible sweets to you…
Have you ever tasted anything so good in your entire life?
I don't want to beat around the bush. I'm asking you to pay a bit more for my goods.
You really won't find chocolates of this quality from other suppliers.
The quality of your chocolates is unsurpassed, but I really can't afford to pay more than this.
I do appreciate where you're coming from, however my offer is firm.
I wish I could do something for you here, but I cannot.
If business were better, I'd be in a better position to change my offer.
Well, my offer stands. Take it or leave it.
Listen. We're in [port] here, not London. This is what I can afford to pay for your goods.
It is not that I don't want to pay more, it's that I simply can't.
What do you take me for here, a fool?
Look. It is what it is. I can only pay what I can pay.
With my sincerest apologies, I'm going to have to hold steady on my offer.
You know, I'd like to continue our good relationship. I'd be willing to pay a bit extra this time…
Your products always fly off the shelves. I can pay a bit more.
I can offer you a higher price - this time. What do you think?
For you, my friend, I can do something today.
I love your chocolates. How do these prices look?
I'm not happy about this, but I suppose I can offer you more.
I've got a lot of demand right now, and not enough supply. I can do something for you today, but don't expect this kind of treatment every time you walk through my door.
You are lucky. I'm in a generous kind of mood today.
Things are going well for us here. I guess I can spread some of our good fortune around.
I want to keep your business. I suppose I can be flexible…
My patience wears thin. I may not need chocolates today, after all.
You are getting a bit big for your britches, there, as they say. Try these prices on for size.
I apologize. On second thought, I don't think I'll be able to pay as much as I had planned.
I've had enough of this conversation.
Business has slowed down. I may have to try to make do with what I've got on hand right now.
I was willing to make you a very decent offer, but I have changed my mind.
I seem to have lost interest in buying chocolates from you today.
You just lost a sale, my friend.
You have pushed me too hard. Our little chat is over.
A warehouse fire has wiped out your supply of %1%.

tragedy.
warehouse fire.
all %1% destroyed.
better buy more.
good luck.
A favorable review of your %1% in %2% has driven up consumer demand.

%2% review in %1% paper.
excellent reader response.
prices up.
Your factory workers in %1% have gone on strike.

factory workers here on strike.
full production halt.
need you to reconfigure factory.
return soon.

telegram from lawyer.
inheritance.
distant relative left you %1%.
deposited in bank.
Demand is high for %1% in %2% this season. Prices are up.
Bad storms off the coast have clearly affected prices. You should expect a high price for %1% in %2% for a while.
The price of %1% is super high in %2% right now - must be having supply troubles, I guess.
Word to the wise: The price of %1% is currently way up in %2%.
A supply ship has sunk, and as a result the price of %1% is through the roof in %2%.
If you have %1% to sell, head for %2% - they're commanding quite the price there of late.
Consumers in %2% can't seem to get enough %1%, and they are driving the price way up.
Judging from their price there, something about %1% has sure tickled the fancy of %2% consumers.
It seems that %1% are all the rage in %2% this season, and their prices reflect the growing demand.
Let's just say that I have it on good authority that %1% will command top dollar in %2% for a while yet.
If you're after a good deal on %1%, be sure to visit %2% soon…
There are some amazing bargains to be had in %2% this season. It seems demand is way off for %1% there.
It is not complicated. Producers are simply over-supplying, so you can take advantage of a great price on %1% in %2%, but you better hurry.
I can't speak for other places, but you'll get a great deal on %1% in %2% for the time being.
The price of %1% is dropping fast in %2% right now - the market must be saturated.
Don't let this get around, but the price is down for %1% in %2%.
There's no accounting for taste, is there? Consumers simply aren't willing to pay top dollar for %1% in %2% these days.
I was just in %2%, and I noticed that the price seemed very low for %1% there.
If you've got %1%, I'd go somewhere other than %2% to sell them - it seems prices there are down just now.
I can't tell you the cause, in fact I wish I knew it myself, but I can tell you that the price of %1% is way off in %2%.
A glut of %1% on the market in %2% has dropped the price there dramatically.
Chocolate lovers in %2% are demanding more %1%, and are willing to pay.
%1% are not selling well in %2%, and prices there are dropping.
A fire in the storage facility in %2% has driven up the price of %1%!
Tropical storms have hampered the delivery of %1% to %2%. Prices are up.

Travel the world to discover the secret ingredients you need to grow your chocolate empire! Create unique confections recipes and foster a new spirit of innovation as you travel the world and play to become a %rank_4%!

In %story_mode% you will meet friends (and perhaps make a few enemies) as you complete adventures, collect recipes, discover new ports, develop new recipes, and help restore the reputation of the once great Baumeister Confections.
Choose %free_mode% to set your own goals, play at your own pace, and explore the world unlocked through your %story_mode% achievements.
The map shows an overview of your chocolate empire. Map icons provide all kinds of valuable information:
Green pins mark ports you have visited. A red "X" marks your current location.
Flashing pins designate newly opened ports. You may even discover secret locations that didn't previously appear on the map!
Steam rises from operational factories; stalled factories appear red.
As you grow your business, you may also acquire shops and a tasting laboratory.
Roll over a port icon for info on cost and length of travel.
In every port there are buildings, monuments, parks, and other public spaces full of interesting people.
Buildings you can explore will highlight briefly when you enter a port or roll over them. Click on a building or location to visit -- you never know who you might meet!

New ports will become available as you complete tasks, build your business, and reach higher ranks in %story_mode%. Be sure to re-visit ports frequently, as new buildings may appear over time. Keep an ear open for rumors of secret locations that may hold the secret ingredients you will need to succeed.
Vendors in markets and farms hawk the ingredients you need for your business. Purchases are transported automatically to the factories where they are needed.
Some markets carry exclusive ingredients, and you'll have to buy varietal cacaos directly from the farmers.
To purchase ingredients, click on a sack and enter the quantity you desire into the cash register. When you are ready, click the "%buy%" button to complete your purchase.
Pay attention to seasons as well as tips to get the best possible prices on ingredients.
If you don't like the prices you see, haggling with the market owner may get you a lower price... but it may also make them angry, so be careful what you say!
Turn your products into cash at chocolate shops around the world. Vary the products you sell to keep prices up, and for higher profits consider investing in shops of your own.
Haggling with the shop keeper may get you a better offer for your products…or it may not!
To sell products, click on a chocolate and enter the quantity to sell into the cash register. When you are ready, click the "%sell%" button to complete the transaction.
As a shortcut, click "%sellall%" to sell every product in your inventory at once.
Your factories manufacture the chocolates you must sell to grow your business.
Click "%reconfigure%" to choose which chocolate to manufacture.
Click "%minigame%" to set the rate of production at the factory and also to make one batch of chocolates.

The factory will continue to make chocolates each and every week as long as you have the proper ingredients on hand. The "Factory Status" tab on your ledger will help you keep on top of production status.
Each product type requires unique machinery, which you can purchase when the time comes.
Use the mouse to aim and fire ingredients into the trays. Fill the tray with ingredients to match the recipe shown, and make as many chocolates as you can in sixty seconds.
The chocolate-making machines turn any full trays into finished chocolates as they go past.
Ingredients that hit a tray snap into the correct slot, and ingredients that miss will be recycled. Miss 8 times and production will be halted.
After you click "%start%" you have one minute to make chocolates and must see it through to the end.
Once configured, the factory will continue making chocolates every week as long as you have enough ingredients on hand.
Ingredients with colored rings can give you a big production boost. Fill a tray with ingredients of the same color to get an instant bonus.
You will meet all kinds of people as you travel the world. Some are friendly, others can be mean, but anyone may play a role in your chocolate-making career.
Take the time to stop and chat. People you meet may offer to trade for new recipes, play games of chance, or share useful information.
In %story_mode% folks may also ask for help or lead you to discover new ingredients, new recipes and new ideas.
Characters may behave differently when they're angry. Sometimes just making a purchase or a sale will help. Sometimes you may have a chance to offer a gift. And as always, time heals all wounds.
The Ledger at the bottom of the screen puts the vital statistics of your chocolate empire at your fingertips.
The Messages tab shows a running history of key events as well as reminders for the future.
The Inventory tab displays all of the ingredients and finished products you have on hand.
The Factory Status tab shows the status of your chocolate factories, including estimates based on current inventory levels and production rates.
The badge shows your current bank balance, rank, game date and score, as well as your collection of medals and trophies.
The Recipe Book displays all of your recipes, organized by type of confection. Collect and discover new recipes to expand your product line!
A white question mark indicates a recipe you have yet to collect.
A chocolate question mark indicates an empty page that will be filled in when you develop a new recipe through your own research.
The sparkle indicates newly acquired recipes.
Golden highlights accent each recipe that you have manufactured.
Browse your recipes by product type using the tabs on the left of the recipe book, then select a chocolate to review its recipe.
Collect recipes from other people or enlist the staff of the Chocolate Tasting Laboratory to help discover marketable recipes that use secret ingredients.
Bring secret ingredients to the Laboratory, where the staff will help you determine the perfect combinations to tempt your customers' palettes.
Whenever you visit the lab, the staff will grab 1 sack of any ingredient they haven't seen before. These ingredients are then always available for your experiments.
Teddy will let you know if it looks like you've got any marketable possibilities of each product type.
Select ingredients from the jars on the shelves to fill the tasting tray. When you're ready, click "%tasteit%".
On his clipboard, the laboratory chief will provide feedback from your experiments, with a red X indicating the ingredients that don't seem to belong. Replace them and try again.
